definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: The theoretical breakthrough of plutonomy originated basically from the breakthrough of productivity.
sentences.chinese: 政治经济学的理论发展根源于生产力的突破。

sentences.english: Him Guan Guoguang painted a piece of picture, have quite " plutonomy " flavour.
sentences.chinese: 关国光自己画了一张图，颇有“政治经济学”的味道。

sentences.english: Some conceptional issues must be solved to push forward the development of the theory of political economy.
sentences.chinese: 政治经济学要发展，必须解决一些观念问题。

sentences.english: It is a great plutonomy work above all.
sentences.chinese: 它首先是一部伟大的政治经济学著作。

sentences.english: They refrained from genuflecting to the laws of political economy.
sentences.chinese: 他们拒不向政治经济学定律顶礼膜拜。

sentences.english: The establishment premise of the Chinese plutonomy is scientific methodology.
sentences.chinese: 中国政治经济学的建立前提是确立科学的方法论。

definition: Das Kapital (1867) by Karl Marx 卡爾·馬克思|卡尔·马克思[Ka3 er3 · Ma3 ke4 si1]
